Description: Rim and body sherd of North Ionian Late Wild Goat pottery bowl; near vertical wall, slight groove just below lip on outside; interior glazed save for broad reserved band near lip; decoration in added red and white, from top: white zig-zag; red band between white bands; exterior, cream slip: at lip, between bands, frieze of tongues with dots in interstices; below, zig-zag band dotted likewise; handle zone frieze preserves head of panther to right. Drill hole in broken edge from sampling for clay analysis.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Aphrodite (Naukratis), area of
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.275)
Jones 1986 / Greek and Cypriot Pottery: a Review of Scientific Studies (p.701, table 8.18, no.18)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
